question: [File: aptos-core/state-sync/inter-component/consensus-notifications/src/lib.rs] [Function: get_transactions()] [Reference safety] Does returning &Vec<Transaction> allow callers to hold references while the notification is still being processed, potentially causing use-after-free? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/inter-component/consensus-notifications/src/lib.rs] [Function: get_target()] [Borrowed reference lifetime] Can the returned &LedgerInfoWithSignatures reference outlive the notification struct, leading to dangling pointer access? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/inter-component/consensus-notifications/src/lib.rs] [Function: notify_new_commit()] [Vector allocation attack] Can an attacker send extremely large transaction vectors that trigger huge memory allocations, causing OOM even if the unbounded channel has backpressure? (High)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/inter-component/consensus-notifications/src/lib.rs] [Struct: ConsensusCommitNotification] [Event vector overflow] Can subscribable_events contain usize::MAX events, causing integer overflow when calculating memory allocation size? (High)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/inter-component/consensus-notifications/src/lib.rs] [Function: sync_for_duration()] [Duration representation] Can extremely large Duration values cause integer overflow in internal time calculations or when converted to milliseconds? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/inter-component/consensus-notifications/src/lib.rs] [Struct: ConsensusNotifier] [Timeout value overflow] Can commit_timeout_ms be set to u64::MAX causing arithmetic overflow when calculating timeout deadlines? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/inter-component/consensus-notifications/src/lib.rs] [Function: new_consensus_notifier_listener_pair()] [Timeout_ms overflow] Can passing u64::MAX as timeout_ms cause Duration::from_millis to overflow or behave unexpectedly? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/inter-component/consensus-notifications/src/lib.rs] [Function: get_latest_synced_ledger_info()] [Clone amplification] Can repeatedly calling this function with large LedgerInfoWithSignatures cause memory amplification attacks where clones consume all memory? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/inter-component/consensus-notifications/src/lib.rs] [Struct: ConsensusNotificationListener] [Receiver leak] If the listener is never polled or dropped without draining, do queued notifications leak memory indefinitely? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/inter-component/consensus-notifications/src/lib.rs] [Function: notify_new_commit()] [Empty check bypass] Does the empty transaction check properly validate both transactions.is_empty() AND subscribable_events.is_empty(), or can events without transactions be processed? (High)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/inter-component/consensus-notifications/src/lib.rs] [Function: notify_new_commit()] [Notification ordering guarantee] Does the channel implementation guarantee FIFO ordering for notifications, or can they be reordered causing commits to be applied out-of-sequence? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/inter-component/consensus-notifications/src/lib.rs] [Function: sync_to_target()] [Target version checking] Is there validation that the target version is greater than current version, or can syncing to older versions cause chain rollback and double-spending? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/inter-component/consensus-notifications/src/lib.rs] [Function: sync_for_duration()] [Minimum sync guarantee] Can the returned ledger info be older than when sync started, violating the expectation that sync makes forward progress? (High)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/inter-component/consensus-notifications/src/lib.rs] [Function: respond_to_commit_notification()] [Atomicity violation] If responding to commit notification fails, is the commit rolled back in state sync, or does it remain partially committed causing inconsistency? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/inter-component/consensus-notifications/src/lib.rs] [Function: notify_new_commit()] [Transaction batch atomicity] Are all transactions in a single notification guaranteed to be committed atomically, or can partial commits occur if state sync crashes mid-processing? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/inter-component/consensus-notifications/src/lib.rs] [Function: sync_to_target()] [Sync completion semantics] Does sync_to_target returning Ok(()) guarantee that state is now at or past the target, or can it return success with state still behind? (High)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/inter-component/consensus-notifications/src/lib.rs] [Function: notify_new_commit()] [Consensus-state sync desync] If consensus thinks a commit succeeded (received Ok) but state sync actually failed to persist, can this cause consensus and state sync to diverge on committed state? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/inter-component/consensus-notifications/src/lib.rs] [Function: sync_for_duration()] [Sync duration race] If consensus makes decisions based on the returned ledger info, but state sync continues syncing past that point, can this cause consensus to make stale decisions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/inter-component/consensus-notifications/src/lib.rs] [Function: notify_new_commit()] [Commit acknowledgment delay] Can the timeout for commit acknowledgment be too short for state sync's actual processing time, causing consensus to think commits failed when they're still in progress? (High)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/inter-component/consensus-notifications/src/lib.rs] [Function: sync_to_target()] [Multiple sync coordination] If both sync_to_target and sync_for_duration are called simultaneously, can they interfere with each other causing neither to complete successfully? (High)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/inter-component/consensus-notifications/src/lib.rs] [Function: notify_new_commit()] [State sync backpressure] Does state sync have mechanism to signal backpressure to consensus, or can consensus overwhelm state sync with commits faster than it can process? (High)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/inter-component/consensus-notifications/src/lib.rs] [Function: sync_for_duration()] [Sync priority inversion] Can sync operations starve commit notifications or vice versa, causing either consensus progress or state sync to halt? (High)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/inter-component/consensus-notifications/src/lib.rs] [Trait: ConsensusNotificationSender] [Interface assumption violation] Does consensus assume synchronous semantics but this interface provides async, potentially causing consensus to make premature decisions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/inter-component/consensus-notifications/src/lib.rs] [Function: notify_new_commit()] [Zero-transaction edge case] Does returning Ok() for empty transactions allow consensus to advance without actually committing anything, potentially breaking consensus invariants? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/state-sync/inter-component/consensus-notifications/src/lib.rs] [Function: new_consensus_notifier_listener_pair()] [Zero timeout edge case] Can timeout_ms = 0 cause immediate timeouts before state sync can even receive the notification? (Medium)
